body_html: For completeness, if you were to draw actually multiple times in different calls to sess.run like in [sess.run(x) for _ in xrange(4)], you'd also get four different random numbers, or if you had different tensors (x = [tf.random_normal(shape=(1,), mean=0.0, stddev=1.0) for _ in xrange(4)]; sess.run(x)) - like @shekkizh says you have just one tensor (which has exactly one value during a computation) and read out its value 4 times.
body_text: For completeness, if you were to draw actually multiple times in different calls to sess.run like in [sess.run(x) for _ in xrange(4)], you'd also get four different random numbers, or if you had different tensors (x = [tf.random_normal(shape=(1,), mean=0.0, stddev=1.0) for _ in xrange(4)]; sess.run(x)) - like @shekkizh says you have just one tensor (which has exactly one value during a computation) and read out its value 4 times.
body: For completeness, if you were to draw actually multiple times in different calls to sess.run like in `[sess.run(x) for _ in xrange(4)]`, you'd also get four different random numbers, or if you had different tensors (`x = [tf.random_normal(shape=(1,), mean=0.0, stddev=1.0) for _ in xrange(4)]; sess.run(x)`) - like @shekkizh says you have just one tensor (which has exactly one value during a computation) and read out its value 4 times.
